page.title: 10Dorset & Salisbury Rlwy.
page.content:
were added to and altered over the years.Due to the rural nature of the line and the then small towns and villages which it passed through very little passenger traffic was carried. When the railway rationalisation was carried out under the leadership of Dr.Beeching this line was one of those listed for closure on the grounds that it was uneconomic.The line was eventually closed completly on the 4 May 1964 despite protests by local residents and the councils of the towns through which it passed.The tracks themselves were lifted shortly afterwards and the track bed offered for sale to landowners whose property adjoined the railway.
Since closure portions of the railway particulaly at Daggons Road and Fordingbridge have been built on
